question.text: Which of these genotypes are of homozygous individuals?

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>
<math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>
<math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi></math>

solution.text: Homozygous individuals breed purely for a character. They should have the same allele for a particular character. <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> is homozygous dominant for <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, homozygous recessive for <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and homozygous dominant for <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>. Thus, this organism is homozygous and will produce only one type of gamete. Similarly, <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi></math> are homozygous too.
